qas.question: How many people are bitten by dogs every year in America?
During the 1980s and 1990s, how many people were killed annually because of dog bites?
In the 2000s, how many people died every year because of dog bites?
According to a 2008 CDC report, how many are bitten in the United States annually?
What decade saw an increase from 17 to 26 deaths caused by dogs?

context: Citing a 2008 study, the U.S. Center for Disease Control estimated in 2015 that <a0_0><a3_0>4.5 million<a3_0/><a0_0/> people in the USA are bitten by dogs each year. A 2015 study estimated that 1.8% of the U.S. population is bitten each year. In the 1980s and 1990s the US averaged <a1_0>17<a1_0/> fatalities per year, while in the <a4_0>2000s<a4_0/> this has increased to <a2_0>26<a2_0/>. 77% of dog bites are from the pet of family or friends, and 50% of attacks occur on the property of the dog's legal owner.
